data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, you can look to the right instead of the left. In the direction you are facing, you should always face forward. In the direction you are facing, you should always face right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps and turn around. Take 4 steps and turn right. In both cases, the directions are exactly the same. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step is the one which takes 6 steps. If we take 4 steps, we turn around and take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step back then turn left to take 7 steps. This is the shortest way back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn left ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ The starting point is the number one location in the series and in this order you go from one point to the other. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is turning left. Right. Take 7 steps. Take 8 steps. Turn left. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Take 9 steps (to return to starting location). So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn right before right, you'll take 8 steps. If you turn right after right, you'll take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You took 6 steps to get from one beginning spot to the next. If you had only taken 8 steps, you may have been able to start from the beginning spot. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should always face forward when moving in a circle. You cannot take steps left when you are facing forward in a circle. The answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around means to go in another direction by moving one' s body around the axis. It is different from return to starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One of the first places to look are your eyes. If you always face forward, a mistake will happen next. Taking one step backwards is a way to get to another place. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting points are in front of you and the ending points are behind you. The starting points can be found at the beginning, middle, and end of the sequence. There are several pieces of information that the sequence requires you to collect. If you can get one piece of info, it would be easier to repeat the sequence correctly. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’s say you have already taken 9 steps left and you need to take 10 steps left. There are 3 steps left for now and 6 steps left for now. If you take 3 steps left now then you now have 9 steps for now and 10 steps left. If you take 3 steps left now and you now have 10 steps left then you now have 10 steps for now and 10 steps left. If you take 3 steps to the right and now you have 4 steps right, you now have 4 steps for now and 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward and always move in one direction, you would continue moving forward from the starting position. You cannot move backward or backward. If you walk backward, you should change your place of origin, taking the 1st step right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
They were always facing forward. They took 3 steps right. They took 6 steps left. They took 1 step forward. They took 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around has 10 steps. 4 steps has 4 steps. 8 steps has 10 steps. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you say you take 10 steps to return to start place and then take 9 more steps, then you can return to the 1st step of the original sequence. The same procedure could be repeated multiple times without the difference being 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 7 steps. Turn around on first step and turn right on the next. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 7 steps you return to the starting point. If you take 7 steps you take 1 step. So, the answer is yes.

Turn right, to take 5 steps back. The first 7 steps would end with the same steps as when you turned right. So, the answer is No.

Turn left on your way to the starting point.

Take the steps as instructed for each step you are going to take back to the starting point. The starting point in this example is in the beginning. So, the answer is no.

If you turn around, your back is already backward so you can't turn around. If you take 10 steps, then you go around, and take 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you start facing in the same direction as you started, you will always start forward from where you started. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is always forward so we don't need to face down nor take backwards steps. The taking backwards step would only make it slightly harder to get backwards. The 'taking left' step would only take you 9 steps and return you to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

This is to make sure that you always face forward when you return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you turn right, you are in the correct direction toward the starting point, and if you turn around, you are in the opposite direction towards the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
